intro: Payena engleri, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits containing seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
